children.name: BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED
children.title: Disabled

children.help: This helps to choose Bluetooth controller stack
children.name: BT_CONTROLLER
children.title: Controller

children.help: Select this option to enable Bluetooth and show the submenu with Bluetooth configuration choices.
children.name: BT_ENABLED
children.title: Bluetooth

children.help: This select btc task stack size
children.name: BT_BTC_TASK_STACK_SIZE
children.title: Bluetooth event (callback to application) task stack size

children.help:
Which the cpu core to run Bluedroid. Can choose core0 and core1.
Can not specify no-affinity.
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_PINNED_TO_CORE_CHOICE
children.title: The cpu core which Bluedroid run

children.help: This select btu task stack size
children.name: BT_BTU_TASK_STACK_SIZE
children.title: Bluetooth Bluedroid Host Stack task stack size

children.help: Enable Espressif Vendor-specific HCI commands for coexist status configuration
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_ESP_COEX_VSC
children.title: Enable Espressif Vendor-specific HCI commands for coexist status configuration

children.help: This chooses the support status of configuring encryption key size
children.name: BT_ENC_KEY_SIZE_CTRL_ENABLED
children.title: configure encryption key size

children.help: This enables functionalities of Host qualification for Classic Bluetooth.
children.name: BT_CLASSIC_BQB_ENABLED
children.title: Host Qualitifcation support for Classic Bluetooth

children.help:
If enable, user shall register audio codec capability to A2DP and encode/decode
audio data in application layer. The internal codec in A2DP will be remove in
the future, it is recommend to use external codec for new design.
children.name: BT_A2DP_USE_EXTERNAL_CODEC
children.title: Use External Codec for A2DP

children.help:
Audio/Video Remote Control Profile, AVRCP and A2DP are coupled in Bluedroid,
AVRCP still controlled by A2DP option, this is a dummy option currently
children.name: BT_AVRCP_ENABLED

children.help: This enable Cover Art feature of AVRCP CT role
children.name: BT_AVRCP_CT_COVER_ART_ENABLED
children.title: AVRCP CT Cover Art

children.help: Advanced Audio Distribution Profile
children.name: BT_A2DP_ENABLE
children.title: A2DP

children.help: This enables the Serial Port Profile
children.name: BT_SPP_ENABLED
children.title: SPP

children.help:
This enables the Logical Link Control and Adaptation Layer Protocol.
Only supported classic bluetooth.
children.name: BT_L2CAP_ENABLED
children.title: BT L2CAP

children.help: This enables common SDP operation, such as SDP record creation and deletion.
children.name: BT_SDP_COMMON_ENABLED
children.title: BT SDP COMMON

children.help:
This is the total size of all SDP attributes allowed.
Any attributes that exceed this size are truncated.
The default value is 300.
children.name: BT_SDP_PAD_LEN
children.title: One or more BT SDP attributes total allocated length (bytes)

children.help:
This is the maximum allowed size for a single SDP attribute.
Any attributes that exceed this size are truncated.
The default value is 300.
children.name: BT_SDP_ATTR_LEN
children.title: Single BT SDP attribute allocated length (bytes)

children.help:
SCO data path, i.e. HCI or PCM. This option is set using API
"esp_bredr_sco_datapath_set" in Bluetooth host. Default SCO data
path can also be set in Bluetooth Controller.
children.name: BT_HFP_AUDIO_DATA_PATH
children.title: audio(SCO) data path

children.help:
If enable, user shall encode/decode audio data in application layer. The internal
codec in HFP will be remove in the future, it is recommend to use external codec
for new design.
children.name: BT_HFP_USE_EXTERNAL_CODEC
children.title: Use External Codec for HFP

children.help:
This enables Wide Band Speech. Should disable it when SCO data path is PCM.
Otherwise there will be no data transmitted via GPIOs.
children.name: BT_HFP_WBS_ENABLE
children.title: Wide Band Speech

children.help:
Hands Free Unit and Audio Gateway can be included simultaneously
but they cannot run simultaneously due to internal limitations.
children.name: BT_HFP_ENABLE
children.title: Hands Free/Handset Profile

children.help: This enables the BT HID Host
children.name: BT_HID_HOST_ENABLED
children.title: Classic BT HID Host

children.help: This enables the BT HID Device
children.name: BT_HID_DEVICE_ENABLED
children.title: Classic BT HID Device

children.help:
This enables the BT HID to remove device bonding information when virtual cable unplugging,
removing device bonding information is optional in HID 1.0 but mandatory in HID 1.1
children.name: BT_HID_REMOVE_DEVICE_BONDING_ENABLED
children.title: Remove Device Bonding Information when HID Virtual Cable Unplugging

children.help: This enables the BT HID functionalities
children.name: BT_HID_ENABLED
children.title: Classic BT HID

children.help: Set the supported features of PBAP Client, the default value is supported all features
children.name: BT_PBAC_SUPPORTED_FEAT
children.title: PBAP Client Supported Features

children.help:
MTU is limited by the max MTU of transport layer, and should not be smaller than 255,
but can be set to zero to use a default MTU of transport layer
children.name: BT_PBAC_PREFERRED_MTU
children.title: PBAP Client Preferred MTU

children.help: This enables the Phone Book Access Profile Client
children.name: BT_PBAC_ENABLED
children.title: PBAP Client

children.help: This enables the BT GOEP Profile Client role
children.name: BT_GOEPC_ENABLED

children.help: For now this option needs "SMP_ENABLE" to be set to yes
children.name: BT_CLASSIC_ENABLED
children.title: Classic Bluetooth

children.help:
This enables "Peripheral Preferred Connection Parameters" characteristic (UUID: 0x2A04)
in GAP service that has connection parameters like min/max connection interval, slave
latency and supervision timeout multiplier
children.name: BT_GATTS_PPCP_CHAR_GAP
children.title: Enable Peripheral Preferred Connection Parameters characteristic in GAP service

children.help: This option can be close when the app does not require blufi function.
children.name: BT_BLE_BLUFI_ENABLE
children.title: Include blufi function

children.help: Maximum GATT Server Profiles Count
children.name: BT_GATT_MAX_SR_PROFILES
children.title: Max GATT Server Profiles

children.help: Maximum GATT Service Attributes Count
children.name: BT_GATT_MAX_SR_ATTRIBUTES
children.title: Max GATT Service Attributes

children.help: Manually send service change indication through API esp_ble_gatts_send_service_change_indication()
children.name: BT_GATTS_SEND_SERVICE_CHANGE_MANUAL
children.title: GATTS manually send service change indication

children.help: Let Bluedroid handle the service change indication internally
children.name: BT_GATTS_SEND_SERVICE_CHANGE_AUTO
children.title: GATTS automatically send service change indication

children.help: Service change indication mode for GATT Server.
children.name: BT_GATTS_SEND_SERVICE_CHANGE_MODE
children.title: GATTS Service Change Mode

children.name: BT_GATTS_ROBUST_CACHING_ENABLED
children.title: Enable Robust Caching on Server Side

children.help: Enabling this option allows remote GATT clients to write device name
children.name: BT_GATTS_DEVICE_NAME_WRITABLE
children.title: Allow to write device name by GATT clients

children.help: Enabling this option allows remote GATT clients to write appearance
children.name: BT_GATTS_APPEARANCE_WRITABLE
children.title: Allow to write appearance by GATT clients

children.help: Enable LE GATT Security Levels Characteristic
children.name: BT_GATTS_SECURITY_LEVELS_CHAR
children.title: Enable LE GATT Security Levels Characteristic

children.help: This option can be disabled when the app work only on gatt client mode
children.name: BT_GATTS_ENABLE
children.title: Include GATT server module(GATTS)

children.help: Maximum GATTC cache characteristic count
children.name: BT_GATTC_MAX_CACHE_CHAR
children.title: Max gattc cache characteristic for discover

children.help: Maximum GATTC notify(indication) register number
children.name: BT_GATTC_NOTIF_REG_MAX
children.title: Max gattc notify(indication) register number

children.help: This select can save gattc cache data to nvs flash
children.name: BT_GATTC_CACHE_NVS_FLASH
children.title: Save gattc cache data to nvs flash

children.help: The number of attempts to reconnect if the connection establishment failed
children.name: BT_GATTC_CONNECT_RETRY_COUNT
children.title: The number of attempts to reconnect if the connection establishment failed

children.help:
Bluetooth Connection establishment maximum time, if connection time exceeds this value, the connection
establishment fails, ESP_GATTC_OPEN_EVT or ESP_GATTS_OPEN_EVT is triggered.
children.name: BT_BLE_ESTAB_LINK_CONN_TOUT
children.title: Timeout of BLE connection establishment

children.help: This option can be close when the app work only on gatt server mode
children.name: BT_GATTC_ENABLE
children.title: Include GATT client module(GATTC)

children.help:
In order to reduce the pairing time, slave actively initiates connection parameters
update during pairing.
children.name: BT_SMP_SLAVE_CON_PARAMS_UPD_ENABLE
children.title: Slave enable connection parameters update during pairing

children.help:
There are tracking risks associated with using a fixed or static IRK.
If enabled this option, Bluedroid will assign a new randomly-generated IRK
when all pairing and bonding records are deleted. This would decrease the ability
of a previously paired peer to be used to determine whether a device
with which it previously shared an IRK is within range.
children.name: BT_BLE_SMP_ID_RESET_ENABLE
children.title: Reset device identity when all bonding records are deleted

children.help: This select can save SMP bonding keys to nvs flash
children.name: BT_BLE_SMP_BOND_NVS_FLASH
children.title: Save SMP bonding keys to nvs flash

children.help:
This enables controller RPA list function.
For ESP32, ESP32 only support network privacy mode. If this option is enabled, ESP32 will only accept
advertising packets from peer devices that contain private address, HW will not receive the advertising
packets contain identity address after IRK changed. If this option is disabled, address resolution will
be performed in the host, so the functions that require controller to resolve address in the white list
cannot be used. This option is disabled by default on ESP32, please enable or disable this option according
to your own needs.

For other BLE chips, devices support network privacy mode and device privacy mode,
users can switch the two modes according to their own needs. So this option is enabled by default.
children.name: BT_BLE_RPA_SUPPORTED
children.title: Update RPA to Controller

children.help: This option can be close when the app not used the ble security connect.
children.name: BT_BLE_SMP_ENABLE
children.title: Include BLE security module(SMP)

children.help: This enables Bluetooth Low Energy
children.name: BT_BLE_ENABLED
children.title: Bluetooth Low Energy

children.help: Bluedroid memory debug
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_MEM_DEBUG
children.title: Bluedroid memory debug

children.help:
Indicates how long it takes for the thread to execute an item
before it is considered blocked.
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_THREAD_BLOCK_TIME
children.title: OSI thread block time (in ms)

children.help:
Indicates how many messages are added to the queue
while the threadis executing an item before it is considered blocked.
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_THREAD_BLOCK_MSG
children.title: OSI thread block message count

children.help:
Enable Bluedroid thread debug mode.
Used to debug whether the thread is blocked and
dump information about the thread’s related work queue.
children.name: BT_BLUEDROID_THREAD_DEBUG
children.title: Bluedroid thread debug

children.help: This select can save the rodata code size
children.name: BT_STACK_NO_LOG
children.title: Disable BT debug logs (minimize bin size)

children.help:
Maximum BT/BLE connection count. The ESP32-C3/S3 chip supports a maximum of 10 instances,
including ADV, SCAN and connections. The ESP32-C3/S3 chip can connect up to 9 devices if
ADV or SCAN uses only one. If ADV and SCAN are both used, The ESP32-C3/S3 chip is connected
to a maximum of 8 devices. Because Bluetooth cannot reclaim used instances once ADV or SCAN
is used.
children.name: BT_ACL_CONNECTIONS
children.title: BT/BLE MAX ACL CONNECTIONS

children.help: Enable this option if there are multiple connections
children.name: BT_MULTI_CONNECTION_ENBALE
children.title: Enable BLE multi-connections

children.help: This select can save the internal RAM if there have the PSRAM
children.name: BT_ALLOCATION_FROM_SPIRAM_FIRST
children.title: BT/BLE will first malloc the memory from the PSRAM

children.help: This select can make the allocation of memory will become more flexible
children.name: BT_BLE_DYNAMIC_ENV_MEMORY
children.title: Use dynamic memory allocation in BT/BLE stack

children.help: The number of security records for peer devices.
children.name: BT_SMP_MAX_BONDS
children.title: BT/BLE maximum bond device count

children.help:
Originally, when doing BLE active scan, Bluedroid will not report adv to application layer
until receive scan response. This option is used to disable the behavior. When enable this option,
Bluedroid will report adv data or scan response to application layer immediately.

# Memory reserved at start of DRAM for Bluetooth stack
children.name: BT_BLE_ACT_SCAN_REP_ADV_SCAN
children.title: Report adv data and scan response individually when BLE active scan

children.help:
Bluetooth Device name length shall be no larger than 248 octets, If the broadcast data cannot contain
the complete device name, then only the shortname will be displayed, the rest parts that can't fit in
will be truncated.
children.name: BT_MAX_DEVICE_NAME_LEN
children.title: length of bluetooth device name

children.help:
This set RPA timeout of Controller and Host.
Default is 900 s (15 minutes). Range is 1 s to 1 hour (3600 s).
children.name: BT_BLE_RPA_TIMEOUT
children.title: Timeout of resolvable private address

children.help: This enables BLE periodic advertising
children.name: BT_BLE_50_PERIODIC_ADV_EN
children.title: Enable BLE periodic advertising

children.help: This enables BLE extend advertising
children.name: BT_BLE_50_EXTEND_ADV_EN
children.title: Enable BLE extend advertising

children.help: This enables BLE periodic advertising sync
children.name: BT_BLE_50_EXTEND_SYNC_EN
children.title: Enable BLE periodic advertising sync

children.help: This enables BLE extend scan
children.name: BT_BLE_50_EXTEND_SCAN_EN
children.title: Enable BLE extend scan

children.help: This enables BLE 5.0 direct test mode
children.name: BT_BLE_50_DTM_TEST_EN
children.title: Enable BLE 5.0 DTM test

children.help:
Enabling this option activates BLE 5.0 features.
This option is universally supported in chips that support BLE, except for ESP32.
BLE 4.2 and BLE 5.0 cannot be used simultaneously.
children.name: BT_BLE_50_FEATURES_SUPPORTED
children.title: Enable BLE 5.0 and above features(please disable BLE 4.2 if enable BLE 5.0)

children.depends_on: BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED && BT_BLE_50_PERIODIC_ADV_EN && ((BT_CONTROLLER_ENABLED && SOC_ESP_NIMBLE_CONTROLLER) || BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED) && BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED && BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED
children.help: This enables BLE periodic advertising sync transfer feature
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_PERIODIC_ADV_SYNC_TRANSFER
children.title: Enable BLE periodic advertising sync transfer feature

children.depends_on: BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED && BT_BLE_50_PERIODIC_ADV_EN && ((BT_CONTROLLER_ENABLED && SOC_ESP_NIMBLE_CONTROLLER) || BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED) && BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED && BT_BLUEDROID_ENABLED
children.help: Enable the periodic advertising enhancements
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_PERIODIC_ADV_ENH
children.title: Enable periodic adv enhancements(adi support)

children.help: Enable the create sync enhancements

children.help: Enable iso 6.0 feature

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 BIG brocaster
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_ISO_BIG_BROCASTER
children.title: Enable BLE iso BIG brocaster

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 BIG syncer
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_ISO_BIG_SYNCER
children.title: Enable BLE iso BIG syncer

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 CIG central

children.title: Enable BLE iso CIG central

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 CIG peripheral
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_ISO_CIG_PERIPHERAL
children.title: Enable BLE iso CIG peripheral

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 CIG peripheral
children.name: BT_BLE_ISO_CIS_MAX_COUNT
children.title: Maximum cis count

children.help: Enable ISO standard flow control
children.name: BT_BLE_ISO_STD_FLOW_CTRL
children.title: ISO standard flow control

children.help: Enable ISO non-standard flow control
children.name: BT_BLE_ISO_NON_STD_FLOW_CTRL
children.title: ISO non-standard flow control

children.help: Select ISO flow control type
children.name: BT_BLE_ISO_FLOW_CONTROL
children.title: Select ISO flow control type

children.help: Enable BLE 5.2 iso
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_ISO_EN
children.title: Enable BLE 5.2 iso feature

children.help: Transmission of CTE in periodic advertising
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_CTE_CONNECTIONLESS_EN
children.title: Enable BLE CTE connectionless feature

children.help: Transmission of CTE by ACL connection
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_CTE_CONNECTION_EN
children.title: Enable BLE CTE connection feature

children.help: Enable BLE 5.1 CTE
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_CTE_EN
children.title: Enable BLE CTE feature

children.help: Enable BLE power control feature
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_POWER_CONTROL
children.title: Enable BLE power control feature

children.help: Enable BLE connection subrating feature
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_CONN_SUBRATING
children.title: Enable BLE connection subrating feature

children.help: Enable BLE Periodic Advertisement with Response(PAwR) feature
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_PAWR_EN
children.title: Enable Periodic Advertisement with Response(PAwR)

children.help: Enable Advertising Coding Selection
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_ADV_CODING_SELECTION
children.title: Enable Advertising Coding Selection

children.help: Enable BLE channel sounding
children.name: BT_BLE_FEAT_CHANNEL_SOUNDING
children.title: Enable BLE channel sounding

children.help: This enables BLE 4.2 direct test mode
children.name: BT_BLE_42_DTM_TEST_EN
children.title: Enable BLE 4.2 DTM test

children.help: This enables BLE v4.2 advertising
children.name: BT_BLE_42_ADV_EN
children.title: Enable BLE 4.2 advertising

children.help: This enables BLE v4.2 scan
children.name: BT_BLE_42_SCAN_EN
children.title: Enable BLE 4.2 scan

children.help:
This enables BLE 4.2 features.
This option is universally supported by all ESP chips with BLE capabilities.
BLE 4.2 and BLE 5.0 cannot be used simultaneously.
children.name: BT_BLE_42_FEATURES_SUPPORTED
children.title: Enable BLE 4.2 features(please disable BLE 5.0 if enable BLE 4.2)

children.help: This enables BLE vendor HCI command and event
children.name: BT_BLE_VENDOR_HCI_EN
children.title: Enable BLE Vendor HCI command and event

children.help: This enable BLE high duty advertising interval feature
children.name: BT_BLE_HIGH_DUTY_ADV_INTERVAL
children.title: Enable BLE high duty advertising interval feature

children.help: This enables abort when memory allocation fails
children.name: BT_ABORT_WHEN_ALLOCATION_FAILS
children.title: Abort when memory allocation fails in BT/BLE stack

children.help:
Allows use of IRAM memory region as 8-bit accessible region.

Every unaligned (8bit or 16bit) access will result in an
exception and incur penalty of certain clock cycles per
unaligned read/write.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MEM_ALLOC_MODE_IRAM_8BIT
children.title: Internal IRAM

children.help:
Allocation strategy for NimBLE host stack. Provides ability to
allocate all required dynamic allocations from:

- Internal DRAM memory only
- External SPIRAM memory only
- Either internal or external memory based on default malloc()
  behavior in ESP-IDF
- Internal IRAM memory wherever applicable else internal DRAM
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MEM_ALLOC_MODE
children.title: Memory allocation strategy

children.help:
The CPU core on which NimBLE host will run. You can choose
Core 0 or Core 1. Cannot specify no-affinity
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PINNED_TO_CORE_CHOICE
children.title: The CPU core on which NimBLE host will run

children.help: This configures stack size of NimBLE host task
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HOST_TASK_STACK_SIZE
children.title: NimBLE Host task stack size

children.help:
This option is used to distinguish whether a previous version
of VHCI is being used
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LEGACY_VHCI_ENABLE

children.help: Enables central role
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ROLE_CENTRAL
children.title: Enable BLE Central role

children.help: Enable peripheral role
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ROLE_PERIPHERAL
children.title: Enable BLE Peripheral role

children.help: Enables broadcaster role
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ROLE_BROADCASTER
children.title: Enable BLE Broadcaster role

children.help: Enables observer role
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ROLE_OBSERVER
children.title: Enable BLE Observer role

children.help: Enables support for GATT Client
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CLIENT
children.title: Enable BLE GATT Client support

children.help: Enables support for GATT Server
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_SERVER
children.title: Enable BLE GATT Server support

children.help: Enable security manager legacy pairing
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SM_LEGACY
children.title: Security manager legacy pairing

children.help:
If this option is enabled, SM uses predefined DH key pair as described
in Core Specification, Vol. 3, Part H, 2.3.5.6.1. This allows to
decrypt air traffic easily and thus should only be used for debugging.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SM_SC_DEBUG_KEYS
children.title: Use predefined public-private key pair

children.help: Enable security manager secure connections
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SM_SC
children.title: Security manager secure connections (4.2)

children.help: Enable encryption connection
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LL_CFG_FEAT_LE_ENCRYPTION
children.title: Enable LE encryption

children.help:
LE Security Mode 1 Levels:
1. No Security
2. Unauthenticated pairing with encryption
3. Authenticated pairing with encryption
4. Authenticated LE Secure Connections pairing with encryption using a 128-bit strength encryption key.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SM_LVL
children.title: Security level

children.help: Enable Secure Connections Only Mode
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SM_SC_ONLY
children.title: Enable Secure Connections Only Mode

children.help: Enable BLE sm feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SECURITY_ENABLE
children.title: Enable BLE SM feature

children.help: Time interval between RPA address change.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_RPA_TIMEOUT
children.title: RPA timeout in seconds

children.help: BLE list size
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_WHITELIST_SIZE
children.title: BLE white list size

children.help: Defines maximum number of connection reattempts.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_CONN_REATTEMPT
children.title: Maximum number connection reattempts

children.help:
Enable to make the NimBLE host to reattempt GAP connection on connection
establishment failure.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ENABLE_CONN_REATTEMPT
children.title: Enable connection reattempts on connection establishment error

children.help:
Use this option to let stack internally handle the request for repeat pairing.
Enabling this option will delete the pairing of the device and stack will NOT post any event
to application. If this option is disabled, application will get BLE_GAP_EVENT_REPEAT_PAIRING
event.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HANDLE_REPEAT_PAIRING_DELETION
children.title: Enable stack handling of repeat pairing

children.help:
Use this option to do host based Random Private Address resolution.
If this option is disabled then controller based privacy is used.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HOST_BASED_PRIVACY
children.title: Enable host based privacy for random address.

children.help: This enables support for user to initiate a new connection with scan in progress
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HOST_ALLOW_CONNECT_WITH_SCAN
children.title: Allow Connections with scanning in progress

children.help:
When scanning and scan duplicate is not enabled, if there are a lot of adv packets around
or application layer handling adv packets is slow, it will cause the controller memory
to run out. if enabled, adv packets will be lost when host queue is congested.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HOST_QUEUE_CONG_CHECK
children.title: BLE queue congestion check

children.help:
Defines maximum number of concurrent BLE connections. For ESP32, user
is expected to configure BTDM_CTRL_BLE_MAX_CONN from controller menu
along with this option. Similarly for ESP32-C3 or ESP32-S3, user is expected to
configure BT_CTRL_BLE_MAX_ACT from controller menu.
For ESP32C2, ESP32C6 and ESP32H2, each connection will take about 1k DRAM.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_CONNECTIONS
children.title: Maximum number of concurrent connections

children.help: Defines maximum number of bonds to save for peer security and our security
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_BONDS
children.title: Maximum number of bonds to save across reboots

children.help: Defines maximum number of CCC descriptors to save
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_CCCDS
children.title: Maximum number of CCC descriptors to save across reboots

children.help: Enable this flag to make bonding persistent across device reboots
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_NVS_PERSIST
children.title: Persist the BLE Bonding keys in NVS

children.help:
There are tracking risks associated with using a fixed or static IRK.
If enabled this option, NimBLE will assign a new randomly-generated IRK
when all pairing and bonding records are deleted. This would decrease the ability
of a previously paired peer to be used to determine whether a device
with which it previously shared an IRK is within range.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SMP_ID_RESET
children.title: Reset device identity when all bonding records are deleted

children.help:
This is the default value of ATT MTU indicated by the device during an ATT MTU exchange.
This value can be changed using API ble_att_set_preferred_mtu()
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ATT_PREFERRED_MTU
children.title: Preferred MTU size in octets

children.help: This is the default value of ATT Maximum prepare entries
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ATT_MAX_PREP_ENTRIES
children.title: Max Prepare write entries

children.help: Maximum number of GATT client procedures that can be executed.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_MAX_PROCS
children.title: Maximum number of GATT client procedures

children.help:
Enable this option to choose mbedTLS instead of TinyCrypt for crypto
computations.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_CRYPTO_STACK_MBEDTLS
children.title: Override TinyCrypt with mbedTLS for crypto computations

children.help: BLE Host stop procedure timeout in milliseconds.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HS_STOP_TIMEOUT_MS
children.title: BLE host stop timeout in msec

children.help: Set this option to use Esp Timer which has higher priority timer instead of FreeRTOS timer
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_USE_ESP_TIMER
children.title: Enable Esp Timer for Nimble

children.help:
This option is used when data to be sent is more than 512 bytes. For peripheral role,
BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_1_BLOCK_COUNT needs to be increased according to the need.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_BLE_GATT_BLOB_TRANSFER
children.title: Blob transfer

children.help: Host flow control interval in msecs
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HS_FLOW_CTRL_ITVL
children.title: Host Flow control interval

children.help:
Host flow control threshold, if the number of free buffers are at or
below this threshold, send an immediate number-of-completed-packets
event
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HS_FLOW_CTRL_THRESH
children.title: Host Flow control threshold

children.help:
Enable this option to send number-of-completed-packets event to
controller after disconnection
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HS_FLOW_CTRL_TX_ON_DISCONNECT
children.title: Host Flow control on disconnect

children.help: Enable Host Flow control
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HS_FLOW_CTRL
children.title: Enable Host Flow control

children.help: Defines maximum number of BLE Connection Oriented Channels. When set to (0), BLE COC is not compiled in
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_L2CAP_COC_MAX_NUM
children.title: Maximum number of connection oriented channels

children.help: Enable Enhanced Credit Based Flow Control Mode
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_L2CAP_ENHANCED_COC
children.title: L2CAP Enhanced Connection Oriented Channel

children.help:
MSYS is a system level mbuf registry. For prepare write & prepare
responses MBUFs are allocated out of msys_1 pool. For NIMBLE_MESH
enabled cases, this block count is increased by 8 than user defined
count.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_1_BLOCK_COUNT
children.title: MSYS_1 Block Count

children.help: Dynamic memory size of block 1
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_1_BLOCK_SIZE
children.title: MSYS_1 Block Size

children.help: Dynamic memory count
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_2_BLOCK_COUNT
children.title: MSYS_2 Block Count

children.help: Dynamic memory size of block 2
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_2_BLOCK_SIZE
children.title: MSYS_2 Block Size

children.help:
This option sets the source of the shared msys mbuf memory between
the Host and the Controller. Allocate the memory from the heap if
this option is sets, from the mempool otherwise.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MSYS_BUF_FROM_HEAP
children.title: Get Msys Mbuf from heap

children.help: The number of ACL data buffers allocated for host.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TRANSPORT_ACL_FROM_LL_COUNT
children.title: ACL Buffer count

children.help:
This is the maximum size of the data portion of HCI ACL data packets.
It does not include the HCI data header (of 4 bytes)
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TRANSPORT_ACL_SIZE
children.title: Transport ACL Buffer size

children.help:
This is the size of each HCI event buffer in bytes. In case of
extended advertising, packets can be fragmented. 257 bytes is the
maximum size of a packet.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TRANSPORT_EVT_SIZE
children.title: Transport Event Buffer size

children.help:
This is the high priority HCI events' buffer size. High-priority
event buffers are for everything except advertising reports. If there
are no free high-priority event buffers then host will try to allocate a
low-priority buffer instead
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TRANSPORT_EVT_COUNT
children.title: Transport Event Buffer count

children.help:
This is the low priority HCI events' buffer size. Low-priority event
buffers are only used for advertising reports. If there are no free
low-priority event buffers, then an incoming advertising report will
get dropped
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TRANSPORT_EVT_DISCARD_COUNT
children.title: Discardable Transport Event Buffer count

children.help: This is the service data unit buffer count for l2cap coc.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_L2CAP_COC_SDU_BUFF_COUNT
children.title: L2cap coc Service Data Unit Buffer count

children.help: Enable 2M-PHY
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LL_CFG_FEAT_LE_2M_PHY
children.title: Enable 2M Phy

children.help: Enable coded-PHY
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LL_CFG_FEAT_LE_CODED_PHY
children.title: Enable coded Phy

children.help: Enable this option to use Extended Adv V2 command instead of V1.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_EXT_ADV_V2
children.title: Enable support for extended adv v2

children.help:
Change this option to set maximum number of extended advertising
instances. Minimum there is always one instance of
advertising. Enter how many more advertising instances you
want.
For ESP32C2, ESP32C6 and ESP32H2, each extended advertising instance
will take about 0.5k DRAM.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_EXT_ADV_INSTANCES
children.title: Maximum number of extended advertising instances.

children.help:
Defines the length of the extended adv data. The value should not
exceed 1650.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_EXT_ADV_MAX_SIZE
children.title: Maximum length of the advertising data.

children.help: Enable the periodic advertising enhancements
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PERIODIC_ADV_ENH
children.title: Periodic adv enhancements(adi support)

children.help: This enables controller transfer periodic sync events to host
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PERIODIC_ADV_SYNC_TRANSFER
children.title: Enable Transfer Sync Events

children.help: This enables controller PAwR (Periodic Advertisement with Response).
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PERIODIC_ADV_WITH_RESPONSES
children.title: Enable Periodic Advertisement with Response (EXPERIMENTAL)

children.help: Enable this option to start periodic advertisement.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ENABLE_PERIODIC_ADV
children.title: Enable periodic advertisement.

children.help:
Enable this option to do extended advertising. Extended advertising
will be supported from BLE 5.0 onwards.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_EXT_ADV
children.title: Enable extended advertising

children.help:
Set this option to set the upper limit for number of periodic sync
connections. This should be less than maximum connections allowed by
controller.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_PERIODIC_SYNCS
children.title: Maximum number of periodic advertising syncs

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit for number of periodic advertiser list.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_PERIODIC_ADVERTISER_LIST
children.title: Maximum number of periodic advertiser list

children.help: Enable this option to receive periodic advertisement.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ENABLE_PERIODIC_SYNC
children.title: Enable periodic sync

children.help: Enable this option to do extended scanning.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_EXT_SCAN
children.title: Enable extended scanning

children.help: Set this option to enable the Power Control feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_BLE_POWER_CONTROL
children.title: Enable support for BLE Power Control

children.help: Enable support for Connectionless and Connection Oriented Direction Finding
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_AOA_AOD
children.title: Direction Finding

children.help: ISO standard flow control
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_STD_FLOW_CTRL
children.title: Standard

children.help: ISO non-standard flow control
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_NON_STD_FLOW_CTRL
children.title: Non-standard

children.help: ISO flow control mode
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_FLOW_CONTROL
children.title: ISO flow control mode

children.help: Enable BLE Isochronous Test functionality.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_TEST
children.title: ISO Test mode

children.help: Maximum number of BIG.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_BIG
children.title: Maximum number of BIG

children.help: Maximum number of BIS.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_BIS
children.title: Maximum number of BIS

children.help: Maximum number of BIS per BIG.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_BIS_PER_BIG
children.title: Maximum number of BIS per BIG

children.help: Maximum number of CIG.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_CIG
children.title: Maximum number of CIG

children.help: Maximum number of CIS.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_CIS
children.title: Maximum number of CIS

children.help: Maximum number of CIS per CIG.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_CIS_PER_CIG
children.title: Maximum number of CIS per CIG

children.help: Enable this to support LE CIS Established event [v2].
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO_CIS_ESTAB_V2
children.title: LE CIS Established event [v2]

children.help: Enable BLE Isochronous functionality.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ISO
children.title: Isochronous channels

children.help: Enable BLE 5 feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_50_FEATURE_SUPPORT
children.title: Enable BLE 5 feature

children.help: Used to enable/disable the channel sounding feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_CHANNEL_SOUNDING
children.title: ble channel souding feature

children.help: Enable support for Monitor Advertisers
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MONITOR_ADV
children.title: Enable Monitor Advertising

children.depends_on: BT_NIMBLE_ENABLED && (SOC_BLE_60_SUPPORTED || BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED) && (SOC_BLE_60_SUPPORTED || BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED) && BT_NIMBLE_ENABLED && (SOC_BLE_60_SUPPORTED || BT_CONTROLLER_DISABLED) && BT_NIMBLE_ENABLED && BT_NIMBLE_ENABLED
children.help: Enable BLE 6 feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_60_FEATURE_SUPPORT
children.title: Enable BLE 6 feature

children.help: Enable Proximity Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PROX_SERVICE
children.title: Proximity service

children.help: Enable Alert Notification Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ANS_SERVICE
children.title: Alert Notification service

children.help: Enable Current Time Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_CTS_SERVICE
children.title: Current Time Service

children.help: Enable Health Thermometer Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HTP_SERVICE
children.title: Health Thermometer service

children.help: Enable Internet Protocol Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_IPSS_SERVICE
children.title: Internet Protocol Support service

children.help: Enable Tx Power Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TPS_SERVICE
children.title: Tx Power service

children.help: Enable Immediate Alert Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_IAS_SERVICE
children.title: Immediate Alert service

children.help: Enable Link Loss Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LLS_SERVICE
children.title: Link Loss service

children.help: Enable Serial Port Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SPS_SERVICE
children.title: Serial Port service

children.help: Enable HeartRate Service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HR_SERVICE
children.title: Heart Rate service

children.help: Defines maximum number of HID service instances
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_HID_MAX_INSTANCES
children.title: Maximum HID service instances

children.help: Defines maximum number of report characteristics per service instance
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_HID_MAX_RPTS
children.title: Maximum HID Report characteristics per service instance

children.help: Enable HID service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HID_SERVICE
children.title: Human Interface Device service

children.help: Enable/Disable notifications on BAS Battery Level Characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_BAS_BATTERY_LEVEL_NOTIFY
children.title: BAS Battery Level NOTIFY permission

children.help: Enable Battery service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_BAS_SERVICE
children.title: Battery service

children.help: Enable the DIS characteristic Manufacturer Name String characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_MANUFACTURER_NAME
children.title: Manufacturer Name

children.help: Enable the DIS Serial Number characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_SERIAL_NUMBER
children.title: Serial Number

children.help: Enable the DIS Hardware Revision characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_HARDWARE_REVISION
children.title: Hardware Revision

children.help: Enable the DIS Firmware Revision characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_FIRMWARE_REVISION
children.title: Firmware Revision

children.help: Enable the DIS Software Revision characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_SOFTWARE_REVISION
children.title: Software Revision

children.help: Enable the DIS System ID characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_SYSTEM_ID
children.title: System ID

children.help: Enable the DIS PnP ID characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_PNP_ID
children.title: PnP ID

children.help: Use DIS as an included service
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_DIS_INCLUDED
children.title: DIS as an Included Service

children.help: Enable Device Information service support
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_DIS_SERVICE
children.title: Device Information Service

children.help:
The Device Name characteristic shall contain the name of the device as an UTF-8 string.
This name can be changed by using API ble_svc_gap_device_name_set()
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_DEVICE_NAME
children.title: BLE GAP default device name

children.help: Device Name characteristic value shall be 0 to 248 octets in length
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GAP_DEVICE_NAME_MAX_LEN
children.title: Maximum length of BLE device name in octets

children.help: Standard BLE GAP Appearance value in HEX format e.g. 0x02C0
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_APPEARANCE
children.title: External appearance of the device

children.help: Enable the LE GATT Security Level Characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_GATT_SECURITY_LEVEL
children.title: LE GATT Security Level Characteristic

children.help: Enable the Resolvable Private Address Only characteristic
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_RPA_ONLY
children.title: Resolvable Private Address Only characteristic

children.help:
Weather or not Central Address Resolution characteristic is supported on
the device, and if supported, weather or not Central Address Resolution
is supported.

- Central Address Resolution characteristic not supported
- Central Address Resolution not supported
- Central Address Resolution supported
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_CENT_ADDR_RESOLUTION
children.title: GAP Characteristic - Central Address Resolution

children.help: Enable write with encryption permission (BLE_GATT_CHR_F_WRITE_ENC)
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_APPEAR_WRITE_ENC
children.title: Write with encryption

children.help: Enable write with authentication permission (BLE_GATT_CHR_F_WRITE_AUTHEN)
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_APPEAR_WRITE_AUTHEN
children.title: Write with authentication

children.help: Enable write with authorisation permission (BLE_GATT_CHR_F_WRITE_AUTHOR)
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SVC_GAP_APPEAR_WRITE_AUTHOR

children.help: Enable GAP Service support

children.help: This enables user to add/remove Gatt services at runtime

children.help:
Enable this option to include *included services* (e.g., services referenced by other services)
in the GATT database cache. Disabling this will skip caching of included service entries.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_INCLUDE_SERVICES
children.title: Include services in GATT caching

children.help: Enable GATT caching
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING
children.title: Enable GATT caching

children.help: Enable this option to start discovery for included service.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_INCL_SVC_DISCOVERY
children.title: Enable Included service discovery

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit on number of connections to be cached.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_MAX_CONNS
children.title: Maximum connections to be cached

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit on number of services per connection to be cached.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_MAX_SVCS
children.title: Maximum number of services per connection

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit on number of included services per connection to be cached.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_MAX_INCL_SVCS
children.title: Maximum number of included services per connection

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit on number of characteristics per connection to be cached.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_MAX_CHRS
children.title: Maximum number of characteristics per connection

children.help: Set this option to set the upper limit on number of descriptors per connection to be cached.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_MAX_DSCS
children.title: Maximum number of descriptors per connection

children.help:
When client receives ATT out-of-sync error message, it will not automatically start the discovery procedure
to correct the invalid cache.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_DISABLE_AUTO
children.title: Do not start discovery procedure automatically upon receiving Out of Sync

children.help: Enable this option to use associated address caching instead of performing service discovery.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATT_CACHING_ASSOC_ENABLE
children.title: Enable association-based GATT caching

children.help: Set this option to enable blufi functionality.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_BLUFI_ENABLE
children.title: Enable blufi functionality

children.help: Defines maximum number of encrypted advertising data key material to save
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MAX_EADS
children.title: Maximum number of EAD devices to save across reboots

children.help: This option is used to enable encrypted advertising data.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_ENC_ADV_DATA
children.title: Encrypted Advertising Data

children.help:
When BLE and Wireless protocol/IEEE 802.15.4 operate in coexistence, BLE preemption
can disrupt the GATT context,causing the service discovery callback to not be invoked.
A temporary list is maintained to preserve the GATT context and use it in case of preemption.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATTC_PROC_PREEMPTION_PROTECT
children.title: Gatt-proc preemption protect check

children.help:
If enabled, when a service request (e.g. read, write) to a server fails, and the ATT
error suggests insufficient security, then the central will initiate pairing and retry
the service request.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_GATTC_AUTO_PAIR
children.title: Automatically pair upon receiving service request failure

children.help: Defines the number of channels EATT bearers can use

children.title: Maximum number of EATT channels

children.help: Enable connection subrate change feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_SUBRATE
children.title: Enable Subrate Change

Enable proxy. This is automatically set whenever NIMBLE_MESH_PB_GATT or
NIMBLE_MESH_GATT_PROXY is set
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MESH_PROXY

children.help:
Enable this option to allow the device to be provisioned over
the advertising bearer

children.help:
Enable this option to allow the device to be provisioned over the GATT
bearer

children.title: Enable mesh provisioning over GATT bearer

This option enables support for the Mesh GATT Proxy Service,
i.e. the ability to act as a proxy between a Mesh GATT Client
and a Mesh network

children.title: Enable GATT Proxy functionality

children.title: Set mesh device name

children.help: Defines mesh node count.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_MESH_NODE_COUNT

children.help: Enable mesh provisioner.

children.title: Enable BLE mesh provisioner

Enable BLE Mesh example present in upstream mynewt-nimble and not maintained by Espressif.

IDF maintains ESP-BLE-MESH as the official Mesh solution. Please refer to ESP-BLE-MESH guide at:

children.help:
Select NimBLE log level. Note that the selected NimBLE log
verbosity can not exceed the level set in
"Component config --> Log output --> Default log verbosity".
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_LOG_LEVEL
children.title: NimBLE Host log verbosity

children.help: Enable feature to give useful explanation for HCI errors
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_PRINT_ERR_NAME
children.title: Enable feature to print Error description

children.help: This enables extra runtime asserts and host debugging
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_DEBUG
children.title: Enable extra runtime asserts and host debugging

children.help: Enable the throughput test mode
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_TEST_THROUGHPUT_TEST
children.title: Throughput Test Mode enable

children.help:
This option is used to enable support for sending Vendor Specific HCI commands and handling
Vendor Specific HCI Events.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_VS_SUPPORT
children.title: Enable support for VSC and VSE

children.help:
This option enables the use of vendor-specific APIs for multi-connections, which can
greatly enhance the stability of coexistence between numerous central and peripheral
devices. It will prohibit the usage of standard APIs.
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_OPTIMIZE_MULTI_CONN
children.title: Enable the optimization of multi-connection

children.help: This enable BLE high duty advertising interval feature
children.name: BT_NIMBLE_HIGH_DUTY_ADV_ITVL
children.title: Enable BLE high duty advertising interval feature

children.help: Specify the bluetooth controller mode (BR/EDR, BLE or dual mode).
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_MODE
children.title: Bluetooth controller mode (BR/EDR/BLE/DUALMODE)

children.help:
BLE maximum connections of bluetooth controller.
Each connection uses 1KB static DRAM whenever the BT controller is enabled.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_BLE_MAX_CONN
children.title: BLE Max Connections

children.help: BR/EDR default minimum size of encryption key when start encryption.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_BR_EDR_MIN_ENC_KEY_SZ_DFT
children.title: BR/EDR default minimum size of encryption key

children.help:
BR/EDR ACL maximum connections of bluetooth controller.
Each connection uses 1.2 KB DRAM whenever the BT controller is enabled.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_BR_EDR_MAX_ACL_CONN
children.title: BR/EDR ACL Max Connections

children.help:
BR/EDR Synchronize maximum connections of bluetooth controller.
Each connection uses 2 KB DRAM whenever the BT controller is enabled.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_BR_EDR_MAX_SYNC_CONN
children.title: BR/EDR Sync(SCO/eSCO) Max Connections

children.help:
SCO data path, i.e. HCI or PCM.
SCO data can be sent/received through HCI synchronous packets, or the data
can be routed to on-chip PCM module on ESP32. PCM input/output signals can
be "matrixed" to GPIOs. The default data path can also be set using API
"esp_bredr_sco_datapath_set"
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_BR_EDR_SCO_DATA_PATH
children.title: BR/EDR Sync(SCO/eSCO) default data path

children.help: PCM role can be configured as PCM master or PCM slave
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_ROLE
children.title: PCM Role

children.help: PCM polarity can be configured as Falling Edge or Rising Edge
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_POLAR
children.title: PCM Polar

children.help:
Stereo Mode(Dual channel): FSYNC and DOUT signals both change simultaneously on the edge of CLK.
The FSYNC signal continues until the end of the current channel-data transmission.
(There is a waveform graph under the path examples/bluetooth/bluedroid/classic_bt/hfp_ag/image)
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_FSYNCSHP_STEREO_MODE
children.title: Stereo Mode

children.help:
Mono Mode 1(Single channel): FSYNC signal starts to change a CLK clock cycle earlier than the DOUT signal.
The FSYNC signal continues for one extra CLK clock cycle.
(There is a waveform graph under the path examples/bluetooth/bluedroid/classic_bt/hfp_ag/image)
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_FSYNCSHP_MONO_MODE_LF
children.title: Mono Mode 1

children.help:
Mono Mode 2(Single channel): FSYNC and DOUT signals both change simultaneously on the edge of CLK.
The FSYNC signal continues for one extra CLK clock cycle.
(There is a waveform graph under the path examples/bluetooth/bluedroid/classic_bt/hfp_ag/image)
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_FSYNCSHP_MONO_MODE_FF
children.title: Mono Mode 2

children.help:
PCM frame synchronization signal shape can be configured as Stereo Mode or Mono Mode.
(There are detailed instructions under the path examples/bluetooth/bluedroid/classic_bt/hfp_ag/README.md)
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_FSYNCSHP
children.title: Channel Mode(Stereo/Mono)

children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PCM_ROLE_EDGE_CONFIG
children.title: PCM Signal Configurations: Role, Polar and Channel Mode(Stereo/Mono)

children.help:
BLE auto latency, used to enhance classic BT performance
while classic BT and BLE are enabled at the same time.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_AUTO_LATENCY
children.title: Auto latency

children.help:
To protect from BIAS attack during Legacy authentication,
Legacy authentication Vendor specific event should be enabled
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_LEGACY_AUTH_VENDOR_EVT
children.title: Legacy Authentication Vendor Specific Event Enable

children.help:
Specify the cpu core to run bluetooth controller.
Can not specify no-affinity.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_PINNED_TO_CORE_CHOICE
children.title: The cpu core which bluetooth controller run

children.help: Normal option. Mostly, choose this VHCI when bluetooth host run on ESP32, too.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HCI_MODE_VHCI
children.title: VHCI

children.help:
If use external bluetooth host which run on other hardware and use UART as the HCI interface,
choose this option.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HCI_MODE_UART_H4
children.title: UART(H4)

children.help: Specify HCI mode as VHCI or UART(H4)
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HCI_MODE_CHOICE
children.title: HCI mode

children.help: Uart number for HCI. The available uart is UART1 and UART2.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HCI_UART_NO
children.title: UART Number for HCI

children.help: UART Baudrate for HCI. Please use standard baudrate.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HCI_UART_BAUDRATE
children.title: UART Baudrate for HCI

children.help:
ORIG mode is a bluetooth sleep mode that can be used for dual mode controller. In this mode,
bluetooth controller sleeps between BR/EDR frames and BLE events. A low power clock is used to
maintain bluetooth reference clock.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_MODEM_SLEEP_MODE_ORIG
children.title: ORIG Mode(sleep with low power clock)

children.help:
EVED mode is for BLE only and is only for internal test. Do not use it for production. this
mode is not compatible with DFS nor light sleep
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_MODEM_SLEEP_MODE_EVED
children.title: EVED Mode(For internal test only)

children.help: To select which strategy to use for modem sleep
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_MODEM_SLEEP_MODE
children.title: Bluetooth Modem sleep mode

children.help: Enable/disable bluetooth controller low power mode.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_MODEM_SLEEP
children.title: Bluetooth modem sleep

children.help:
Main crystal can be used as low power clock for bluetooth modem sleep. If this option is
selected, bluetooth modem sleep can work under Dynamic Frequency Scaling(DFS) enabled, but
cannot work when light sleep is enabled. Main crystal has a good performance in accuracy as
the bluetooth low power clock source.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_LPCLK_SEL_MAIN_XTAL
children.title: Main crystal

children.help:
External 32kHz crystal/oscillator has a nominal frequency of 32.768kHz and provides good frequency
stability. If used as Bluetooth low power clock, External 32kHz can support Bluetooth
modem sleep to be used with both DFS and light sleep.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_LPCLK_SEL_EXT_32K_XTAL
children.title: External 32kHz crystal/oscillator

children.help:
Select the low power clock source for bluetooth controller. Bluetooth low power clock is
the clock source to maintain time in sleep mode.

- "Main crystal" option provides good accuracy and can support Dynamic Frequency Scaling
  to be used with Bluetooth modem sleep. Light sleep is not supported.
- "External 32kHz crystal" option allows user to use a 32.768kHz crystal as Bluetooth low
  power clock. This option is allowed as long as External 32kHz crystal is configured as
  the system RTC clock source. This option provides good accuracy and supports Bluetooth
  modem sleep to be used alongside Dynamic Frequency Scaling or light sleep.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_LOW_POWER_CLOCK
children.title: Bluetooth low power clock

children.help:
BLE Sleep Clock Accuracy(SCA) for the local device is used to estimate window widening in BLE
connection events. With a lower level of clock accuracy(e.g. 500ppm over 250ppm), the slave
needs a larger RX window to synchronize with master in each anchor point, thus resulting in an
increase of power consumption but a higher level of robustness in keeping connected. According
to the requirements of Bluetooth Core specification 4.2, the worst-case accuracy of Classic
Bluetooth Low Power Oscillator (LPO) is +/-250ppm in STANDBY and in low power modes such as
sniff. For BLE the worst-case SCA is +/-500ppm.

- "151ppm to 250ppm" option is the default value for Bluetooth Dual mode
- "251ppm to 500ppm" option can be used in BLE only mode when using external 32kHz crystal as
   low power clock. This option is provided in case that BLE sleep clock has a lower level of
   accuracy, or other error sources contribute to the inaccurate timing during sleep.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_SLEEP_CLOCK_ACCURACY
children.title: BLE Sleep Clock Accuracy

children.help:
This way is to use advertiser address filtering. The adv packet of the same address is only
allowed to be reported once
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_TYPE_DEVICE
children.title: Scan Duplicate By Device Address

children.help:
This way is to use advertising data filtering. All same advertising data only allow to be reported
once even though they are from different devices.
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_TYPE_DATA
children.title: Scan Duplicate By Advertising Data

children.help:
This way is to use advertising data and device address filtering. All different adv packets with
the same address are allowed to be reported.
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_TYPE_DATA_DEVICE
children.title: Scan Duplicate By Device Address And Advertising Data

children.help:
Scan duplicate have three ways. one is "Scan Duplicate By Device Address", This way is to use
advertiser address filtering. The adv packet of the same address is only allowed to be reported once.
Another way is "Scan Duplicate By Device Address And Advertising Data". This way is to use advertising
data and device address filtering. All different adv packets with the same address are allowed to be
reported. The last way is "Scan Duplicate By Advertising Data". This way is to use advertising data
filtering. All same advertising data only allow to be reported once even though they are from
different devices.
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_TYPE
children.title: Scan Duplicate Type

children.help:
Maximum number of devices which can be recorded in scan duplicate filter.
When the maximum amount of device in the filter is reached, the oldest device will be refreshed.
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_CACHE_SIZE
children.title: Maximum number of devices in scan duplicate filter

children.help:
If the period value is non-zero, the controller will periodically clear the device information
stored in the scan duuplicate filter. If it is 0, the scan duuplicate filter will not be cleared
until the scanning is disabled. Duplicate advertisements for this period should not be sent to the
Host in advertising report events.
There are two scenarios where the ADV packet will be repeatedly reported:
1. The duplicate scan cache is full, the controller will delete the oldest device information and
add new device information.
2. When the refresh period is up, the controller will clear all device information and start filtering
again.
children.name: BTDM_SCAN_DUPL_CACHE_REFRESH_PERIOD
children.title: Duplicate scan list refresh period (seconds)

children.help:
Maximum number of adv packets which can be recorded in duplicate scan cache for BLE Mesh.
When the maximum amount of device in the filter is reached, the cache will be refreshed.
children.name: BTDM_MESH_DUPL_SCAN_CACHE_SIZE
children.title: Maximum number of Mesh adv packets in scan duplicate filter

children.help: This enables the BLE scan duplicate for special BLE Mesh scan.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_MESH_SCAN_DUPL_EN
children.title: Special duplicate scan mechanism for BLE Mesh scan

children.help: This select enables parameters setting of BLE scan duplicate.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_SCAN_DUPL
children.title: BLE Scan Duplicate Options

children.help:
The full scan function is mainly used to provide BLE scan performance.
This is required for scenes with high scan performance requirements, such as BLE Mesh scenes.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_FULL_SCAN_SUPPORTED
children.title: BLE full scan feature supported

children.help:
Disable active scan backoff. The bluetooth spec requires that scanners should run a backoff procedure to
minimize collision of scan request PDUs from multiple scanners. If scan backoff is disabled, in active
scanning, scan request PDU will be sent every time when HW receives scannable ADV PDU.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_SCAN_BACKOFF_UPPERLIMITMAX
children.title: Disable active scan backoff

children.help:
Enabling this option will add stricter verification of the Access Address in the CONNECT_IND PDU.
This improves security by ensuring that only connection requests with valid Access Addresses are accepted.
If disabled, only basic checks are applied, improving compatibility.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_CHECK_CONNECT_IND_ACCESS_ADDRESS
children.title: Enable enhanced Access Address check in CONNECT_IND

children.help:
The number of unprocessed advertising report that Bluedroid can save.If you set
`BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_FLOW_CTRL_NUM` to a small value, this may cause adv packets lost.
If you set `BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_FLOW_CTRL_NUM` to a large value, Bluedroid may cache a
lot of adv packets and this may cause system memory run out. For example, if you set
it to 50, the maximum memory consumed by host is 35 * 50 bytes. Please set
`BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_FLOW_CTRL_NUM` according to your system free memory and handle adv
packets as fast as possible, otherwise it will cause adv packets lost.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_FLOW_CTRL_NUM
children.title: BLE adv report flow control number

children.help:
When adv report flow control is enabled, The ADV lost event will be generated when the number
of ADV packets lost in the controller reaches this threshold. It is better to set a larger value.
If you set `BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_DISCARD_THRSHOLD` to a small value or printf every adv lost event, it
may cause adv packets lost more.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_DISCARD_THRSHOLD
children.title: BLE adv lost event threshold value

children.help:
The function is mainly used to enable flow control for advertising reports. When it is enabled,
advertising reports will be discarded by the controller if the number of unprocessed advertising
reports exceeds the size of BLE adv report flow control.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_ADV_REPORT_FLOW_CTRL_SUPP
children.title: BLE adv report flow control supported

children.help:
If this option is enabled, Controller will terminate the connection
when Instant Passed (0x28) error occurs during connection update procedure.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_LLCP_CONN_UPDATE
children.title: BLE ACL connection update procedure

children.help:
If this option is enabled, Controller will terminate the connection
when Instant Passed (0x28) error occurs in channel map update procedure.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_LLCP_CHAN_MAP_UPDATE
children.title: BLE ACL channel map update procedure
BLE disconnects when Instant Passed (0x28) occurs

children.help:
If this option is enabled, The Controller will records the communication quality
for each channel and then start a timer to check and update the channel map every 4 seconds.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_CHAN_ASS_EN
children.title: Enable channel assessment

children.help:
If this option is disabled, The Controller will not start the LE authenticated payload timer.
This option is used for some compatibility problems related to LE ping procedure.
children.name: BTDM_BLE_PING_EN
children.title: Enable LE Ping procedure

children.help:
Enables specific debugging features for the Bluetooth controller.
This option is strictly for internal debugging purposes and should not be enabled in production environments,
as it may impact performance and stability.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_CONTROLLER_DEBUG_MODE_1
children.title: Enable Bluetooth controller debugging mode 1 (for internal use only)

children.help: Using Level 4 interrupt for Bluetooth.
children.name: BTDM_CTRL_HLI
children.title: High level interrupt

children.help:
This option release Bluetooth text section and merge Bluetooth data, bss & text into
a large free heap region when esp_bt_mem_release is called, total saving ~21kB or more of IRAM.
ESP32-C2 only 3 configurable PMP entries available, rest of them are hard-coded.
We cannot split the memory into 3 different regions (IRAM, BLE-IRAM, DRAM).
So this option will disable the memory protection scheme (ESP_SYSTEM_MEMPROT)
children.name: BT_RELEASE_IRAM
children.title: Release Bluetooth text (READ DOCS FIRST)

children.help:
This option decides the maximum number of alarms which
could be used by Bluetooth host.
children.name: BT_ALARM_MAX_NUM
children.title: Maximum number of Bluetooth alarms

children.help: Stack size for BLE Log Task
children.name: BLE_LOG_TASK_STACK_SIZE
children.title: Stack size for BLE Log Task

children.help:
There're 2 log buffer managers (LBMs) with compare-and-swap
(CAS) protection, 1 LBM with FreeRTOS mutex protection, 1 LBM
without protection for critical section. Each LBM is managing
2 ping-pong buffers, which means there will be 4 * 2 *
BLE_LOG_LBM_TRANS_SIZE bytes buffer allocated
children.name: BLE_LOG_LBM_TRANS_SIZE
children.title: Buffer size for each peripheral transport

children.help:
BLE Log module will search for an LBM with atomic lock protection first; if
all LBMs with atomic lock protection are unavailable, BLE Log module will
try to use the LBM with spin lock protection. So the more LBMs with atomic
lock protection are created, the better the logging performance will be.
children.name: BLE_LOG_LBM_ATOMIC_LOCK_TASK_CNT
children.title: Count of log buffer managers with atomic lock protection for task context

children.help:
BLE Log module will search for an LBM with atomic lock protection first; if
all LBMs with atomic lock protection are unavailable, BLE Log module will
try to use the LBM with spin lock protection. So the more LBMs with atomic
lock protection are created, the more ISRs can nest.
children.name: BLE_LOG_LBM_ATOMIC_LOCK_ISR_CNT
children.title: Count of log buffer managers with atomic lock protection for ISR context

children.help: Current BLE Controller is ESP BLE Controller
children.name: BLE_LOG_IS_ESP_CONTROLLER
children.title: Current BLE Controller is ESP BLE Controller

children.help: Current BLE Controller is ESP BLE Legacy Controller
children.name: BLE_LOG_IS_ESP_LEGACY_CONTROLLER
children.title: Current BLE Controller is ESP BLE Legacy Controller

children.help:
There're 2 Link Layer dedicated log buffer managers (LBMs) with
compare-and-swap (CAS) protection. Each LBM is managing 2 ping-
pong buffers, which means there will be additional 2 * 2 *
BLE_LOG_LBM_LL_TRANS_SIZE bytes buffer allocated
children.name: BLE_LOG_LBM_LL_TRANS_SIZE
children.title: Buffer size for each peripheral transport of Link Layer LBM

children.help: Enable BLE Log for Link Layer
children.name: BLE_LOG_LL_ENABLED
children.title: Enable BLE Log for Link Layer

children.help:
Checksum is the default method for BLE Log data integrity check,
but for targets with slow CPU speed, it may cause significant system
performance decrease; a compromise could be made to balance the
realtime performance and log data integrity, which is calculating the
checksum of frame head and payload all together by default, or only
calculate the checksum of frame head to minimize performance decrease
children.name: BLE_LOG_PAYLOAD_CHECKSUM_ENABLED
children.title: Enable payload checksum for BLE Log data integrity check

children.help:
Enable enhanced statistics for written/lost frame/bytes count, which may
cost additional ~100kB memory

children.title: BLE Mesh log buffer length

children.help:
When this option is enabled, the log data will be output
through both the compressed log interface and the original
UART interface at the same time, meaning that the log
statements will appear on both paths. However, please note
that this dual-output approach introduces additional code
and string constants, which will increase the size of the
firmware binary file. When this option is disabled, the
logs will no longer be printed through the original UART
output path; instead, they will only be output through the
compressed log interface. As the code and strings related
to the original UART output are omitted, the size of the
firmware binary file can be effectively reduced.

children.help:
Apply compression to ESP-BLE-MESH protocol stack logs. Requires
base BLE compression to be enabled. Specifically optimizes log
storage and transmission for ble mesh.

Note: This library depends on additional Python packages. It will
function correctly only after these dependencies are installed;
refer to:
"components/bt/common/ble_log/log_compression/README.en.md"
for installation instructions.

If the required packages are not installed, the log-compression
mechanism will remain disabled even when this Config is enabled.

children.name: BLE_BLUEDROID_APPL_DEBUG_LOG_COMPRESSION
children.title: Compress debug log of Bluedroid host

children.help: Please refer to the help information in BLE_BLUEDROID_APPL_ERROR_LOG_PRESERVE
children.name: BLE_BLUEDROID_APPL_VERBOSE_LOG_PRESERVE
children.title: Keep the original verbose log statement

children.help: The verbose log in the  Bluedroid host component will be compressed
children.name: BLE_BLUEDROID_APPL_VERBOSE_LOG_COMPRESSION
children.title: Compress verbose log of Bluedroid host
Select the APPL layer log tag to be compressed

children.help:
Apply compression to host logs. Requires
base BLE compression to be enabled. Specifically optimizes log
storage and transmission.

Note: This library depends on additional Python packages. It will
function correctly only after these dependencies are installed;
refer to:
"components/bt/common/ble_log/log_compression/README.en.md"
for installation instructions.
children.name: BLE_HOST_COMPRESSED_LOG_ENABLE
children.title: Enable BLE Host log compression(Preview, only Bluedroid Host for now)

children.help:
Compress BLE logs during application build to reduce flash usage
and improve output speed. When enabled, log data from Bluetooth
Low Energy components will be compressed before storage,
optimizing both memory footprint and transmission efficiency.

Note: This library depends on additional Python packages. It will
function correctly only after these dependencies are installed;
refer to:
"components/bt/common/ble_log/log_compression/README.en.md"
for installation instructions.
children.name: BLE_COMPRESSED_LOG_ENABLE
children.title: Enable BLE log compression(Preview, Please read help information)

children.help: Enable BLE Log Module
children.name: BLE_LOG_ENABLED

SPI transaction buffer size for upper layer task logs.
There will be 2 SPI DMA buffers with the same size.

Output ble logs via UHCI (UART DMA) driver
